packagecontents.text: (1) E300 Series router with embedded LTE Advanced Pro (C18B) modem

insertSim:
Insert Activated SIM Cards

  1. Remove the modem door.
    • Check the lower right-hand side of the door for the modem door screw.

  1. Insert an active 2FF-sized SIM card into the slot with the contacts down and notch in. It will click into place. Depress the SIM card to remove it.
  1. Repeat for SIM 2 if needed.


Insert an External MC400 Modem(optional)

  1. Insert 1 or 2 active 2FF-sized SIM cards into the MC400 modem, contacts down, notch in.

  1. Insert the MC400 modem into the router, USB port in, Cradlepoint logo up.


  1. Replace the MC400 modem door and secure with modem door screw.


    • NOTE: Peel off the modem door decal to expose antenna port openings.
    • NOTE: The modem door must be on the device or the embedded modem will not power on.
attachCellularAntenna:
Attach the 4G LTE Antennas

  1. Attach the included cellular modem antennas to the ports marked MAIN and DIV.

  1. Hold the antenna straight and twist the base onto the device. Tighten with fingers only (maximum torque not to exceed 4 in-lbs). Do not over-tighten.
  1. Angle the antennas based on the following diagram using the included antenna alignment tool.


Attach MC400 4G LTE Antennas

  1. Attach the included cellular modem antennas to the ports marked MAIN and AUX.


  1. Hold the antenna straight and twist the base onto the device. Tighten with fingers only (maximum torque not to exceed 4 in-lbs). Do not over-tighten.
  1. Angle the antennas based on the following diagrams.
getConnect:
Connect a Wired WAN

  1. Connect the provided Ethernet cable to the WAN port of the router. Connect the other end to your WAN source.
    • NOTE: The port labeled 'WAN' is the default. However, all ports are LAN/WAN switchable.
poweron:
Connect the Power Source

  1. Connect the power supply to the router and then plug the other end into an electrical outlet.
  1. Switch the device to ON (O = OFF, â€“ = ON). The LED lights will begin lighting up.
